intro: Stigmaphyllon olivaceum, commonly known as the olive-stemmed stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
